headline: Why Verizon’s Surprise CEO Change Rattled the Wireless Industry
summary: Verizon’s  unexpected CEO transition is shaking up wireless stocks, and likely signaling increased competition ahead, Wall Street analysts warn.  Verizon appointed lead independent director Daniel Schulman as its new CEO on Monday, effective immediately.  With this new transition, Verizon will focus on maximizing value propositions, reducing costs, and delivering sustainable long-term growth for shareholders, according to Monday’s news release.

headline: Verizon (VZ) Down 5% Amid Fresh Leadership Changes
summary: We recently published 10 Stocks Investors Are Dumping. Verizon Communications Inc. (NYSE:VZ) is one of the worst performers on Monday. Verizon dropped its share prices by 5.11 percent on Monday to close at $41.44 apiece as investors digested leadership changes in the company, with former PayPal chief Dan Schulman taking the CEO position effective immediately. […]

headline: Verizon (VZ): Assessing Valuation Following Modest Gains and Recent Share Price Retreat
summary: Verizon Communications (VZ) shares have edged lower over the past month, slipping around 7%. The stock’s year-to-date gains remain modest. Recent trading reflects some caution from investors, despite the company’s steady revenue and net income growth. See our latest analysis for Verizon Communications. While Verizon's share price has retreated in the past month, recent performance hints at steady, if unspectacular, progress. The stock shows mild year-to-date gains, and over the last year...
